CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Such high energy alignment would not enable to achieve a large open - circuit voltage and is eventually detrimental to the PCE output of PT - based PSCs such as in P3HT / PCBM systems with PCE ranging from 3 to 4% . 21,22 Geng and co-workers synthesized two PT - based donor materials by incorporating carboxylate side chains and vinylene linkers between thiophene units. The HOMO and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels of the resulting polymers , PBT and PTT , were substantially stabilized when compared to those of the parent P3HT. Such energy level lowering was attributed to the integration of carboxylate and vinylene groups giving rise to a push - pull structural motif , resulting in an enhanced PCE of the PV devices based on them. 21 Over the years , the use of the structural effect to enhance PSC performance has been extensively investigated , particularly the donor - acceptor ( D-A ) strategy , which has been proved to be an effective approach to develop donor polymers with wide absorption , low - lying energy levels , and enhanced electron properties. 23-32 Besides , conjugation expansion on the polymer backbone is an alternative tool to improve the electronic properties of polymers. By replacing a branched 2ethylhexyl side chain with a linear n-octyl group , Zhang and his co-workers synthesized a PTB7-Th derivative namely , PBTT. PV cells based on PBTT : IEICO showed a superior device performance than that of the PTB7-Th - based device with a PCE of 9.5% , a V oc of 0.86 V , a J sc of 17.9 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 61.3% . Such dramatic enhancement in efficiency was attributed to a higher charge mobility and improved morphology of the PBTT : IEICO blend film induced by the less steric hindered linear alkyl side chain. 1 Yang and coworkers used selenophene to replace thiophene π-bridge in the indacenodithiophene (IDT)-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione (BDD)-based copolymer ( PThBDDIDT ) to develop a donor-π-acceptor type copolymer , PSeBDDIDT. The PCE of solar cells based on polymer : PC71BM as an active layer was dramatically increased from 7.04 to 8.65% , respectively. Such improvement could result from stronger intermolecular interactions , expanded absorption range , and better molecular planarity of selenophene contained PSeBDDIDT. 33 Random terpolymers comprised of thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido [ 3,4- g]- thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione , thiophene( T ) , and dithiophene ( 2T ) were synthesized by Yang and co-workers in which the crystallinity of terpolymers could be controlled by varying the compositions of T and 2T. The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% . 34 Fluorination on polymer backbones has also been widely adopted to tune and improve the functional properties of donor polymers such as stabilization of their energy levels and hence positively impacting on PSC performance.

Let's think step by step.

1. P3HT - a polythiophene-based conjugated polymer
2. PT - another name for polythiophene
3. PBT and PTT - two PT-based donor materials
4. PV devices - photovoltaic devices
5. HOMO - highest occupied molecular orbital
6. LUMO - lowest unoccupied molecular orbital
7. D-A strategy - donor-acceptor strategy
8. PTB7-Th - a polythiophene-based conjugated polymer
9. PBTT - a PT-based derivative
10. IEICO - an acceptor material
11. PThBDDIDT - a copolymer
12. BDD - benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione
13. IDT - indacenodithiophene
14. PSeBDDIDT - a donor-π-acceptor type copolymer
15. T - thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido [3,4- g]- thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione
16. 2T - dithiophene
17. Fluorination - a process of introducing fluorine atoms into a molecule.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. P3HT
2. PT
3. PBT
4. PTT
5. IEICO
6. PThBDDIDT
7. BDD
8. IDT
9. PSeBDDIDT
10. T
11. 2T
12. Fluorination

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| P3HT |
| PT |
| PBT |
| PTT |
| IEICO |
| PThBDDIDT |
| BDD |
| IDT |
| PSeBDDIDT |
| T |
| 2T |
| Fluorination |

The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% . 34 Fluorination on polymer backbones has also been widely adopted to tune and improve the functional properties of donor polymers such as stabilization of their energy levels and hence positively impacting on PSC performance.

Let's think step by step.

1. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) energy levels
2. Lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) energy levels
3. Charge mobility
4. Morphology
5. Absorption range
6. Molecular planarity
7. Crystallinity
8. Energy levels (implied)
9. Polymer backbones (implied)

1. HOMO energy levels

3. Charge mobility
4. Morphology

6. Molecular planarity

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Such high energy alignment would not enable to achieve a large open - circuit voltage and is eventually detrimental to the PCE output of PT - based PSCs such as in P3HT / PCBM systems with PCE ranging from 3 to 4% . 21,22 Geng and co-workers synthesized two PT - based donor materials by incorporating carboxylate side chains and vinylene linkers between thiophene units. The HOMO and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels of the resulting polymers , PBT and PTT , were substantially stabilized when compared to those of the parent P3HT. Such energy level lowering was attributed to the integration of carboxylate and vinylene groups giving rise to a push - pull structural motif , resulting in an enhanced PCE of the PV devices based on them. 21 Over the years , the use of the structural effect to enhance PSC performance has been extensively investigated , particularly the donor - acceptor ( D-A ) strategy , which has been proved to be an effective approach to develop donor polymers with wide absorption , low - lying energy levels , and enhanced electron properties. 23-32 Besides , conjugation expansion on the polymer backbone is an alternative tool to improve the electronic properties of polymers. By replacing a branched 2ethylhexyl side chain with a linear n-octyl group , Zhang and his co-workers synthesized a PTB7-Th derivative namely , PBTT. PV cells based on PBTT : IEICO showed a superior device performance than that of the PTB7-Th - based device with a PCE of 9.5% , a V oc of 0.86 V , a J sc of 17.9 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 61.3% . Such dramatic enhancement in efficiency was attributed to a higher charge mobility and improved morphology of the PBTT : IEICO blend film induced by the less steric hindered linear alkyl side chain. 1 Yang and coworkers used selenophene to replace thiophene π-bridge in the indacenodithiophene (IDT)-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione (BDD)-based copolymer ( PThBDDIDT ) to develop a donor-π-acceptor type copolymer , PSeBDDIDT. The PCE of solar cells based on polymer : PC71BM as an active layer was dramatically increased from 7.04 to 8.65% , respectively. Such improvement could result from stronger intermolecular interactions , expanded absorption range , and better molecular planarity of selenophene contained PSeBDDIDT. 33 Random terpolymers comprised of thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido [ 3,4- g]- thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione , thiophene( T ) , and dithiophene ( 2T ) were synthesized by Yang and co-workers in which the crystallinity of terpolymers could be controlled by varying the compositions of T and 2T. The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% . 34 Fluorination on polymer backbones has also been widely adopted to tune and improve the functional properties of donor polymers such as stabilization of their energy levels and hence positively impacting on PSC performance.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) of PT-based PSCs (Polymer Solar Cells) such as P3HT/PCBM systems: 3-4%
2. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) and LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) energy levels of polymers PBT and PTT: not specified in the text
3. PCE of PV devices based on PBT and PTT: enhanced, but no specific value is given
4. Charge mobility and morphology of PBTT: not specified in the text
5. PCE, Voc (Open-Circuit Voltage), Jsc (Short-Circuit Current Density), and FF (Fill Factor) of PV cells based on PBTT:PCE of 9.5%, Voc of 0.86 V, Jsc of 17.9 mA cm-2, and FF of 61.3%
6. PCE of solar cells based on PThBDDIDT: 7.04%
7. PCE of solar cells based on PSeBDDIDT: 8.65%
8. Jsc and FF of PSC based on a terpolymer with optimized T/2T ratio: Jsc of 18.3 mA cm-2 and FF of 71.2%
9. PCE of PSC based on a terpolymer with optimized T/2T ratio: 10.8%
10. Energy level stabilization of donor polymers through fluorination: not specified in the text.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. PCE of PT-based PSCs such as P3HT/PCBM systems: 3-4%
2. PCE of PV devices based on PBT and PTT: enhanced
3. PCE of PV cells based on PBTT: 9.5%
4. Voc of PV cells based on PBTT: 0.86 V
5. Jsc of PV cells based on PBTT: 17.9 mA cm-2
6. FF of PV cells based on PBTT: 61.3%
7. PCE of solar cells based on PThBDDIDT: 7.04%
8. PCE of solar cells based on PSeBDDIDT: 8.65%
9. Jsc of PSC based on a terpolymer with optimized T/2T ratio: 18.3 mA cm-2
10. FF of PSC based on a terpolymer with optimized T/2T ratio: 71.2%
11. PCE of PSC based on a terpolymer with optimized T/2T ratio: 10.8%
